metadata.name: PUA - NirCmd Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\nircmd.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('nircmd.exe') OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' execmd ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe script ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe shexec ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' runinteractive ')) OR (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' exec ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' exec2 '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' show ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' hide ')))))

output.summary: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: Legitimate use by administrators References: https://www.nirsoft.net/utils/nircmd.html, https://www.winhelponline.com/blog/run-program-as-system-localsystem-account-windows/, https://www.nirsoft.net/utils/nircmd2.html#using
